function.description: It returns the absolute value of a number. Example: abs(-24)Result: 24
Returns the arc cosine of number. Example: acos(0.25) result: 1.318116071652818
Returns the arc sine of number. Example: asin(0.25) result: 0.25268025514207865
Returns the arc tangent of number. Example: atan(0.25) result: 0.24497866312686414
Returns the arc tangent of given number. Example: atan2(0.50,1) result: 0.4636476090008061
Displays a value rounded to a certain number of decimal places. Example: round(34.4158,2) result: 34.42
Returns number rounded up to the nearest integer. Example: ceiling(0.25) result: 1
Returns the cosine of number. Example: cos(0.25) result: 0.9689124217106447
Returns the cotangent of an angle. Specify the angle in radians. Example: 1/tan(0.25) result: 3.9163173646459399
Converts angle number in radians to degrees. Example: degrees(0.25) result: 14.32394487827058
Returns the integer part of a division operation. Example: (10/5) result: 2
Returns Eulerâ€™s number raised to the power of the given number. Example: exp(2) result: 7.389
Returns number rounded down to the nearest number. Example: floor(3.1415) result: 3
Returns the natural logarithm of number. Example: ln(2) result: 0.6931471805599453
Returns the base 10 logarithm of number. Example: log10(2) result: 0.3010299956639812
Returns the largest of the provided values. Example: greatest(4,13) result: 13
Returns the smallest of the provided values. Example: least(13,4) result: 4
Returns the constant Pi. Example: pi() result: 3.14159

function.signature: (case when(${number})>0 then 1 when(${number})=0 then 0 when(${number})<0 then -1 else null end)
function.description: Returns the signum function of number, that is: 0 if the argument is 0, 1 if the argument is greater than 0, -1 if the argument is less than 0. Example: sign(0.5) result: 1.
Returns the sine of number. Example: sin(0.25) result: 0.24740395925452294
Displays the value of a number raised to the power of another number. Example: pow(4,2) result: 16
Converts the value of a number from degrees to radians. Example : radians(4) result : 0.06981317007977318
Displays the square root of a non-negative number. Example: sqrt(5) result: 2.23606797749979
It displays the square of a given number. Example: (4*4) result: 16
Returns the tangent of number. Example: tan(0.25) result: 0.25534192122103627
Displays a number truncated to a certain number of decimal places. Example: truncate(1.289,2) result: 1.28
Returns the number of characters in string. Example : LENGTH('Bengaluru') result:9
Converts all characters in the specified string to lowercase. Example: LOWER('BENGALURU') result: bengaluru
Converts all characters in a string to uppercase. Example: UPPER('bengaluru') result: BENGALURU.
It removes leading and trailing whitespace from string. Example: TRIM(' Bengaluru ') result:Bengaluru
Removes leading whitespace from string. Example: LTRIM(' Bengaluru') result: Bengaluru
Removes trailing whitespace from string. Example: RTRIM('Bengaluru ') result: Bengaluru.
Returns the string starting from specified position. If position is more than string or length is less than 1 it will return empty string. Example: substr('Bengaluru', 2, 5) result: engal
String search for substring and replace it with replacestring. If substring is not found, the string is not changed. Example: REPLACE('bengaluru','b','Z') result: Zengaluru
Returns the rightmost character from the string. Example: right('bengaluru',4) result: 'luru'

Displays a string that is left padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than string, return value is truncated to length characters. Example: substr('Hills' || 'Wellesley', -14, 14) result:HillsWellesley.
Returns the left most characters in a string. Example: LEFT ('Bengaluru', 4) result:Beng.

Returns the starting position of the first instance of substring in string. Positions start with 1. If not found, 0 is returned. Example :position('z','Bengaluru') result : 0, position('aluru' IN 'Bengaluru') result : 5

function.signature: case when(${string} like concat('%',${substring})) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if the given string endswith specified substring. Example:case when('postgres' like concat('%','res')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.

function.signature: case when(${string} like concat(${substring},'%')) then 'true' else 'false' end
function.description: Returns true if string starts with substring. Example: case when('bengaluru' like concat('ben','%')) then true else false end result: true. Note:Please provide single quotes if you are directly typing the substring value.
Returns true if the given string contains the specified substring. Example : case when (position('bengaluru','a')> 0) then 'true' else 'false' end result:true

Displays a string that is right padded with a specified string to a certain length. If length is less than string, return value is truncated to length characters.Length must not be negative and padString must not be non-empty. Example:substr('Wellesley' || 'Hills', 1, 14) result : Wellesley Hills.
Returns string with the characters in reverse order. Example: REVERSE('Bengaluru') result : urulagneB
Returns the concatenation of string1, string2. Example: CONCAT('Beng','aluru') result : Bengaluru

Returns the specified date with the specified number of interval added to the specified date_part of that date.Example: addYears(toDate('2019-01-01'), 2) result:2016-03-08 supported units:year. Note : Third parameter not required any value.
Returns the difference between date1 and date2 by comparing the provided unit . Example: dateDiff('month',toDate('2014-03-08'), toDate('2019-03-08')) result: 84. Supported units : Year, month, day
Returns day of the month for date/datetime (1-31). Example: day(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')/day(date '2014-03-08')result: 8

function.signature: case when length(${year}) <> 0 OR length(${month}) <> 0 OR length(${day}) <> 0 then cast(concat(${year},'-',${month},'-',${day}) AS date ) else null end
function.description: Returns a date for given year, month and day. Example: case when length('2013') greaterthanLessthan 0 OR length('07') greater than less than 0 OR length('15') greater than less than 0 then cast(concat('2013','-','07','-','15') AS date ) else null end result : 2013-07-15 Note : Replace greaterthanLessthan with greaterthanLessthan symbols.
Returns an integer that represents the specified unit of the specified date. Example: extract(year FROM date '2014-03-08') result: 2014. supported unit:YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH , WEEK , DAY
Truncates the specified date to the accuracy specified by the unit. Example:date_trunc(year, '2014-03-08') result: 2014-01-01 supported units:year,month,day,week.
Displays Current date.

Returns the specified datetime with the specified number interval added to the unit of that datetime. Example:addYears(toDateTime('2014-03-08 11:10:27'), 2) result:2016-03-08 11:10:27 supported units:Year. Note :Third parameter not required any value.
Returns the difference between datetime1 and datetime2 with provided unit. Example:dateDiff('year',toDateTime( '2014-03-08 09:00:00'), toDateTime('2019-03-08 09:00:00'))result: 5.

function.signature: case when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime}))=1 then 'monday' when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime})) = 2 then 'Tuesday' when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime})) = 3 then 'Wednesday' when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime})) = 4 then 'Thursday' when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime})) = 5 then 'Friday' when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime})) = 6 then 'Saturday' when(toDayOfWeek(${datetime})) = 7 then 'Sunday' else null end
function.description: Retruns the name of the week day for date/dateTime. Example: dayname(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00')/dayname(date '2007-02-03') result: 'Saturday'

Returns an integer that represents the specified datepart of the specified datetime. Example: extract(year FROM timestamp '2014-03-08 12:32:42') result: 2014. supported date_part:YEAR, QUARTER, MONTH , WEEK , DAY, YEAR_MONTH, MICROSECOND, SECOND, MINUTE, HOUR, MINUTE_SECOND, HOUR_MICROSECOND, DAY_SECOND.
Returns the month of the year for date/dateTime. Example: month(timestamp '2007-02-03 09:00:00')/month(date '2007-02-03') result: 2

Truncates the specified datetime to the accuracy specified by the format(unit). Example: DATETIME_TRUNC(DATETIME '2014-03-08 12:20:19', DAY) result :2014-03-08 00:00:00 supported units:year,month,day,hour,minute,second,week
Returns the year for date/datetime. Example: year(timestamp '2014-03-08 09:00:00')/year(date '2014-03-08') result: 2014

function.signature: (case when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=01 then 'January' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=02 then 'February' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=03 then 'March' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=04 then 'April' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=05 then 'May' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=06 then 'June' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=07 then 'July' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=08 then 'August' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=09 then 'September' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=10 then 'October' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=11 then 'November' when (Extract(month from (${datetime})))=12 then 'December' else null end)
function.description: Returns the month name based on the given date/datetime. Example: monthname('2014-08-08 08:00:00.000') result: August

Returns the ISO day of the week for date/datetime. The value ranges from 1 (sunday) to 7 (saturday). Example: toDayOfWeek(toDate('2007-02-03'))/toDayOfWeek(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00')) result: 7.
Displays Current date and time. This function equivalent to current_timestamp.
Return a DATETIME format as a string.Example:formatDateTime(toDateTime('2014-03-08 09:00:00'),'%F %T') result:2014-03-08 09:00:00
Takes a string as input and displays a dateTime in a specific format. Example:PARSE_DATETIME('2008-01-31 09:00:00','%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') result: 2008-01-31 00:00:00

function.signature: ( (case when length(${year}) <> 0 OR length(${month}) <> 0 OR length(${day}) <> 0 OR length(${hour}) <> 0 OR length(${minute}) <> 0 OR length(${second}) <> 0 then CAST(concat(${year},'-',${month},'-',${day},' ', ${hour},':', ${minute},':', ${second}) as timestamp) else null end))
function.description: Returns a datetime that combines a year,month,day,hour,min,sec. Example: case when length('2013') greaterthanLessthan 0 OR length('07') greaterthanLessthan 0 OR length('15') greaterthanLessthan 0 OR length('08') greaterthanLessthan 0 OR length('15') greaterthanLessthan 0 OR length('23') greaterthanLessthan 0 then CAST(concat('2013','-', '07','-','15',' ', '08',':', '15',':', '23') as timestamp) else null end result: 2013-7-15 8-15-23. Note : Replace greaterthanLessthan with greaterthanLessthan symbols.
Returns the hour for timestamp. The value ranges from 0 to 23. Example: hour(toDateTime(2007-02-03 09:00:00')) result: 12
Returns the minute for time. Example: minute(toDateTime(2007-02-03 09:00:00')) result:20
Returns the second for time. Example: second(toDateTime(2007-02-03 09:00:00')) result:19
Returns the quarter of the year for date/datetime. Example: quarter(toDateTime(2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/quarter(toDateTime(2007-02-03 09:00:00')) result:1
Returns the ISO week of the year for date/dateTime. The value ranges from 0 to 53. Example: week(toDateTime('2014-03-08 12:20:19'))/week(toDateTime('2014-03-08 12:20:19'))result: 9

Cast function converts one datatype to another. Note:All Values should be in single quotes if you are typing the value. Example: CAST('2019-03-22 17:34:03.000' AS String) result:2019-03-22 17:34:03.000
Converts value to char type. Example: cast('2015-01-01' AS string) result:2015-01-01
This function converts value to a number type. Example: cast(23.3 AS signed) result:23

Converts value to DATE type. Format is "YYYY-MM-DD" (Supported range is from "1000-01-01" to "9999-12-31").Example: CAST('2019-02-12 14:06:10' AS date) RESULTS: 2019-02-12.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing

Converts value to DATETIME type. Format is "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" (Supported range is from "1000-01-01 00:00:00" to "9999-12-31 23:59:59"). Example:CAST('2019-02-12' AS datetime) RESULTS: 2019-02-12 00:00:00.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing
Converts the value to decimal type. Example: cast(23.3 as decimal) result: 23

If the value exists in the JSON document, 1 will be returned otherwise 0 will be returned. Example:JSONHas('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'b') = 1 Note : indices_or_keys is a list of zero or more arguments each of them can be either string or integer.
Return the length of a JSON array or a JSON object. Example:JSONLength('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'b')=3 Note : If the value does not exist or has a wrong type, 0 will be returned..
Return the Json value.If the value does not exist, Null will be returned. Example:JSONType('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}') = Object

Parses a JSON and extract a value. These functions are similar to visitParam functions.If the value does not exist or has a wrong type, 0 will be returned. Example:JSONExtractUInt('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'b', -1) = 300

Parses a JSON and extract a value. These functions are similar to visitParam functions.If the value does not exist or has a wrong type, 0 will be returned. Example:JSONExtractInt('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'b', 1) = -100

Parses a JSON and extract a value. These functions are similar to visitParam functions.If the value does not exist or has a wrong type, 0 will be returned. Example:JSONExtractFloat('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'b', 2) = 200.0

Parses a JSON and extract a value. These functions are similar to visitParam functions.If the value does not exist or has a wrong type, 0 will be returned. Example:JSONExtractString('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'a') = hello

Parses a JSON and extract a value. These functions are similar to JSONExtract('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'String') returns exactly the same as JSONExtractString(), JSONExtract('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'Float64') returns exactly the same as JSONExtractFloat() Example:JSONExtract('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'Tuple(String, Array(Float64))') = ('hello',[-100,200,300])
Parse key-value pairs from a JSON Example:JSONExtractKeysAndValues('{"x": {"a": 5, "b": 7, "c": 11}}', 'x', 'Int8') = [('a',5),('b',7),('c',11)]
Returns a part of JSON. Example:JSONExtractRaw('{"a": "hello", "b": [-100, 200.0, 300]}', 'b') = [-100, 200.0, 300]

Performs a logical conjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will 'drag column'. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide condition value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' condition , 'AND' conditions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0.( Note : In such case don't provide anything in 'condition' and 'value' parameter). We will use AND inside IF. Example: IF (creditlim > = 50000 AND creditlim > = 10000), 'Gold', 'silver' )

Inside case we will use when condition. Evaluates each condition from left to right and returns the result when the first condition met. If no condition met return from else if exist, otherwise return null. Example : CASE WHEN Quantity > 30 THEN "The quantity is greater than 30" ELSE "The quantity is under 30" END
Returns from statement_list when condition gets fail.We will use ELSE inside case function. Example: CASE when 50 > 0 then 'true' else 'false'

Evaluates conditions and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. We will use ELSEIF inside IF 'conditiontrue' parameter. Example:IF creditlim > 50000 'PLATINUM', IF (creditlim > = 50000) 'GOLD', 'SILVER'

Inside IF we will use AND, OR conditions. Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR', 'AND' conditions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 (Note : In such case don't provide anything in 'condition' parameter and 'value' parameter). Example : IF (creditlim > 50000) 'PLATINUM','SILVER'
Returns Expr1 if it is not null otherwise return expr2. Example : (coalesce(null, '1234')) Results:'1234'
Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is true, otherwise return 'conditionfalse'. Example : IF (creditlim > 50000) 'PLATINUM','SILVER'

Inside WHEN condition we will use ISNULL. Evalutes and returns 'Conditiontrue' if the expression contain Null. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 ISNULL THEN Conditionfalse. Example2 : CASE WHEN NULL ISNULL THEN Conditiontrue

Evaluates and returns 'conditiontrue' if condition is false, otherwise returns 'conditionfalse'. We will use NOT inside IF. Example : NOT(500 > 1000) result :0 Note : True returns '0' and false returns '1'

Performs a logical disjunction on two expressions. In 'column' paramter we will drag column. In 'condition' parameter provide conditions like (>,= etc.,). In 'value' parameter provide value. In 'moreconditions' parameter we will use nested 'OR' , 'AND' functions. Instead of dragging column directly we will write expression in column parameter like 50 > 0 in such case don't provide anything in 'condition' and 'value' parameter. We will use OR inside IF. Example : IF (creditlim > = 50000 OR creditlim > = 10000), 'Gold', 'silver' )

Returns 'statement_list' when condition get satisfied . In column paramter we will drag column. In searchcondition parameter provide conditions like (>, =, IS Null etc .,). In value parameter provide value(Note : IS Null used in 'condition' parameter then don't provide anything in 'value' parameter). In moreconditions parameter we will use nested when conditions, Else condition . We will use WHEN inside CASE. Example1 : CASE WHEN 1 > 0 THEN 'one' else 'TWO'. Example2 : CASE WHEN 'Singapore' IS NULL THEN 'Singa' ELSE 'pore'. Example3 : CASE WHEN Washington like '%sh%' THEN 'return washington' else 'NotMatched'
Returns "expression" if it is not null, otherwise returns zero.Example :if(null IS NULL, '0','123') result :'0'.NOTE:Return types for the this function should be same.
Returns 1 for an empty string and 0 for a non-empty string. Example: empty('bengaluru') result: 0.
Returns 0 for an empty string and 1 for a non-empty string. Example: notEmpty('bengaluru') result: 1.
Returns 1, if the set of bytes is valid UTF-8 encoded, otherwise 0. Example: isValidUTF8('bengaluru') result: 1. Example2 : isValidUTF8('\xE0\x80\x80') result:0

Returns formatted pattern with string list of arguments. Example1 : format('{1} {0}', 'Bengaluru', 'Karnataka') result :Karnataka Bengaluru. Example2:format('{} {}', 'Bengaluru', 'Karnataka') result : Bengaluru Karnataka Note : pattern can be numbers or empty

If the 'string' is non-empty and does not contain the 'character' in the 'string' at the end, it appends the 'character' to the end. Example1 : appendTrailingCharIfAbsent('bengaluru', 'u') result :bengaluru. Example2:appendTrailingCharIfAbsent('bengaluru', 'z') result : bengaluruz
Returns Encodes string into base64. Example:base64Encode('bengaluru') result : YmVuZ2FsdXJ1

Returns Decode base64-encoded string into original string. Example:base64Decode('YmVuZ2FsdXJ1') result : bengaluru Note : In string parameter when encoded string is provided in that case it will show error.
Returns the CRC32 checksum of a string. Example:CRC32('bengaluru') result:2014394675
Returns a Float64 number that is close to the number e. Example:e() result:2.718281828459045
Returns a Float64 number close to the binary logarithm of the argument. Example:log2(2) result:4.0
Returns cubic root of the number. Example:cbrt(2) result:1.2599210498948734
Returns the number of the day of the year. Example:toDayOfYear(toDate('2014-03-08')) result:67
Converts a datetime to a unix timestamp. Example:toUnixTimestamp(toDateTime('2014-03-08 12:32:42')) result:1394262162
Returns first day of ISO year for date or datetime. Example:toStartOfISOYear(toDateTime('2014-03-08 12:32:42'))/ toStartOfISOYear(toDate('2014-03-08'))result:2013-12-30
Returns date of the nearest monday for date or datetime. Example:toMonday(toDateTime('2014-03-08 12:32:42'))/toMonday(toDate('2014-03-08')) result:2014-03-03

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the quarter, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeQuarterNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeQuarterNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:8028

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the month, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeMonthNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeMonthNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:24086

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the week, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeWeekNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeWeekNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:1935

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the day, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeDayNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeDayNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:13547

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the hour, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeHourNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeHourNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:325150

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the minute, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeMinuteNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeMinuteNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:19507890

Converts a datetime or date to the number of the second, starting from a certain fixed point in the past. Example:toRelativeSecondNum(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00'))/toRelativeSecondNum(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:1170473400
Converts a date or datetime to a UInt8 number containing the ISO Week number. Example:toISOWeek(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00')))/toISOWeek(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:5
Returns year and week for a date or datetime. Example:toYearWeek(toDateTime('2007-02-03 09:00:00')))/toYearWeek(toDate('2007-02-03')) result:200704
Accepts zero arguments and returns yesterday's date at one of the moments of request execution. The same as 'today() - 1'. Example:yesterday() result:2019-10-16
Converts the datetime to string
Converts the time to string
Converts the date to string

Converts the number,date,dateTime,time to string.Eg:CAST(120) RESULTS:'120'.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing and its data type is "text/date/dateTime/time" type

Converts the number,date,dateTime,time to string.Eg:CAST(120) RESULTS:'120'.NOTE: column's value should be in quotes if the values is manually typing and its data type is "text/date/dateTime/time" type
